text: We are just days away from getting our hands on Hunter Biden‚Äôs bank records. think it was about six hours. I looked at them and said: ‚ÄòI‚Äôm leaving in six hours. If the prosecutor is not fired, you‚Äôre not getting the money.‚Äô‚Äù

The confidential informant alleges that Bursima hired Hunter Biden to be on the board and agreed to pay him $5,000,000 in exchange for helping with their IPO, problems with the SEC, and asset purchases of oil and gas rights in the United States. Burisma needed Hunter Biden‚Äôs help because the company was under investigation by Ukrainian Prosecutor General Viktor Shokin. The cloud of illegitimacy surrounding Burisma due to the prosecution prevented it from raising capital in the United States. Following Hunter‚Äôs hiring, then-Vice President Joe Biden threatened to withhold billions of dollars of loan guarantees for Ukraine unless Viktor Shokin was fired.

I voted no on the debt ceiling boondoggle.

Our national debt is a threat to our national security. This President clearly does not appreciate that.

Families in South Carolina have made some difficult decisions in the Biden economy. Washington is long overdue to do the same. I will not support increasing the federal government‚Äôs credit limit on their maxed out credit card without real structural change that puts our country on a path toward fiscal sanity.

It is past time to talk about the real drivers of our debt. Our future generations depend on it.

I am voting NO on the debt ceiling deal which does nothing to reform Washington‚Äôs spending addiction or address the core drivers of our nation‚Äôs nearly $32 trillion (and growing!) national debt. 
 
The fact of the matter is that our national debt is either a national security threat or it is not. I was not sent to Washington to perpetuate bad fiscal policy, and voting in favor of this bill would do just that. 
 
If we are to truly address our nation‚Äôs fiscal solvency, we must have serious and uncomfortable conversations about the true drivers of our debt. That did not happen during this ‚Äúdeal.‚Äù
 
In the era of sky-high inflation and rising interest rates, my constituents in the Upstate of South Carolina have had to make some tough decisions. It is past time for Washington to do the same. 
 
I am voting no to increasing the nation‚Äôs credit card limit until we implement real change. There is simply too much at stake.
